Name: Photonic Blast
Rules: Hero Action (attack): Deal 5 damage to an enemy. If you paid for this card using a {e} resource, draw 1 card.

Name: Alpha Flight Station

Printings.Flavor: This low-orbit space station can beam cargo and crew to and from the Triskelion.

Rules: Action: Exhaust Alpha Flight Station, choose and discard 1 card from your hand → draw 1 card (draw 2 cards instead if you are Carol Danvers).

Name: Supersonic Punch

Printings.Flavor: "Nice technique. But if you do it like this... it hurts more." —Tony Stark

Rules: Hero Action (attack): Deal 4 damage to an enemy (8 damage instead if you have the Aerial trait).

Name: Tactical Genius
Rules:
Special (thwart): Remove 1 threat from a scheme (2 threat instead if this is the final step of this sequence).
(Play the "Wakanda Forever!" event to use this ability.)

Name: Ant-Man
Rules:
While you are in Giant hero form, Ant-Man gains the Giant trait and gets +1 ATK.
While you are in Tiny hero form, Ant-Man gains the Tiny trait and gets +1 THW.

Name: Sure Gamble
Rules:
Unit Cost 5.
Hero Action: Reduce the resource cost of the next card played this phase by 3.

Name: Power Unleashed
Rules:
Unit Cost 7.
Hero Action: Deal 5 damage to the villain and remove 5 threat from the main scheme. Remove this card from the game.

Name: Tried and True
Rules:
Unit Cost 7.
Hero Action: Choose a player. That player may add up to 3 cards from their discard pile to their hand. Remove this card from the game.

Name: Triple Threat
Rules:
Unit Cost 7.
Hero Action: Ready up to 3 characters. Remove this card from the game.

Name: Bounty
Rules:
Attach to a minion with the Brute, Criminal, or Mercenary trait, or to a unique ({u}) enemy. Max 1 per enemy.
Response: After attached enemy is attacked and defeated, the owner of this card draws 2 cards. If the attacker has the Hero for Hire trait, heal 1 damage from them.

Name: Munitions Cache
Rules:
Enters play with 2 ammo counters and 2 charge counters. Max 1 per player.
Action: Exhaust Munitions Cache → move 1 ammo counter or 1 charge counter from this card to another upgrade you control.

Name: Thorn in Their Side

Printings.Flavor: *BAMF* *BAMF* *BAMF*

Rules: Hero Action (thwart): Remove 2 threat from a scheme. Then, you may take up to 5 damage and remove 1 threat from a scheme for each point of damage you took this way divided among schemes as you choose.

Name: Sustenance
Rules:
Play only if your identity has the Avenger trait.
Hero Action: Heal 1 damage from your identity. Heal X additional damage from your identity where X is equal to the villain's stage number.

Name: Detonate
Rules: Hero Action (attack): Discard an upgrade you control with counters on it, then deal X damage to the villain and each minion engaged with you, where X is the number of counters discarded this way.

Name: Flight

Printings.Flavor: "What on earth? Where's he going?"

Rules:
Play only if your identity has the Aerial trait.
Hero Action: Place 2 threat on the main scheme → stun and confuse the villain.

Name: Dark Magic
Rules:
Play only if your identity has the Mystic trait. Max 1 per deck.
Hero Action (attack): Shuffle your deck. Choose an enemy and remove up to 3 cards from the top of your deck from the game → drain 2 from that enemy for each card removed this way.

Name: Heroes for Hire
Rules:
Play under any player's control. Max 1 Team card per player.
If each of your allies has the Hero for Hire trait, this card gains: "Response: After an ally you control defeats an enemy, draw 1 card."

Name: Outer Space Ambush
Rules:
Alliance.
Hero Action (attack): Exhaust an Avenger character and a Guardian character and deal 1 damage to each of them → deal a total of 6 damage divided among enemies as you choose. If neither of these friendly characters were defeated this way, ready them.

Name: Resistance Training
Rules:
Max 2 per deck. Uses (2 training counters).
Alter-Ego Action: Exhaust this card and remove 1 training counter from it → choose a Determination (purple) event in your discard pile and shuffle it into your deck.

Name: Laura Kinney

Printings.Flavor: "I learned from the best."

Rules:
Setup: Search your deck and discard pile for the Adamantium Claws upgrade and add it to your hand. (Shuffle.)

Printings.Flavor: "I think you pissed off my sister."

Rules: Interrupt: When Honey Badger would be defeated, shuffle her into your deck instead and heal 1 damage from your identity.

X-23 gains retaliate 1.
Hero Interrupt: When you would take any amount of damage, exhaust Combat Expertise → prevent 1 of that damage.

Hero Interrupt (defense): When Silk would take any amount of damage, look at the top 4 cards of your deck. For each printed resource looked at this way, if it was:
{p} - Draw 1 card.
{m} - Prevent 2 of that damage.
{w} - Both of the above.

Increase the target threat value of the main scheme by X, where X is equal to the villain stage number.

Rules: Response: After you spend this card to play a Cosmic event, deal 2 damage to an enemy.

Name: Batman

Printings.Flavor: "You are a part of the night, just like me. We're not afraid of the dark — we come alive in it..." —Catwoman

Rules: Response: After Batman attacks or thwarts, Catwoman gets +1 ATK or +1 THW until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)

Name: Catlike Reflexes

Printings.Flavor: "How many are following us now? Just two? So insulting!" —Catwoman

Rules: Hero Interrupt: When an enemy initiates an attack, Catwoman resolves her ATK against that enemy without exhausting.

Name: Cat Pounce

Printings.Flavor: "Meow." —Catwoman

Rules: Hero Action (attack): Deal 2 damage to an enemy → ready Catwoman.

Name: Selina's Apartment
Rules:
Selina Kyle gets +1 REC (+2 REC instead if Bruce Wayne is in play).
Interrupt: When you perform Selina Kyle's "Rubbing Elbows" ability, shuffle the topmost card from your discard pile into your deck.

Name: Catwoman's Whip
Rules:
Restricted.
Catwoman's basic attacks gain ranged.
Hero Response: After you play a Cornered Animal upgrade, discard a card from your hand and exhaust Catwoman's Whip → give Catwoman a tough status card.

Name: Cornered Animal

Printings.Flavor: "I'm warning you, don't back me into a corner!"

Rules:
Catwoman gains retaliate 1.
Catwoman gets +1 ATK and her basic attacks gain piercing.
Forced Interrupt: At the end of the round, discard this card.

Name: Thief at Heart
Rules:
Increase the per phase limit of Catwoman's "Cat Burglar" ability by 1.
Hero Action: Exhaust this card and spend 1 resource of any type → search the encounter deck for an attachment. Shuffle the encounter deck. Place that attachment on top of the encounter deck.

Name: Dr. Harleen Quinzel

Printings.Flavor: "That's why I went into psychiatry! Public service!"

Rules: Psychotherapy — Action: Remove a status card from a character and give it to your identity. If there are no status cards in play, stun or confuse Dr. Harleen Quinzel. (Limit once per round.)

Name: Poison Ivy

Printings.Flavor: "Give 'em hell, Harley!" —Poison Ivy

Rules: Response: After Poison Ivy enters play, choose a character. Heal 2 damage from that character or give that character a status card.

Name: Mayhem!
Rules:
Hero Action: Choose one:
• (attack): Deal 3 damage to an enemy.
• (thwart): Remove 2 threat from a scheme.
You may repeat the above action 1 additional time for each status card on your character.

Name: Insanity's Embrace

Printings.Flavor: "Twice the smarts of Batman and all the vitamins of a bowl of oranges." —Harley Quinn

Rules: Action: Remove a status card from your identity. If a stunned status card was removed this way, confuse your identity and ready it. If a confused status card was removed this way, stun your identity and draw 1 card. Shuffle this card into your deck.

Name: Vexing Agility

Printings.Flavor: "I am known to be quite vexing." —Harley Quinn

Rules: Hero Interrupt (defense): When your hero defends against an attack, it gets +X DEF for that attack, where X is equal to 2 more than the number of status cards on your hero. If you take no damage from that attack, the next time you are dealt an encounter card, discard it.

Name: Immersion Therapy

Printings.Flavor:
"Are you even a doctor?" —Artemis
"Mostly!" —Harley Quinn

Rules: Action: Choose stunned or confused → give a status card of the chosen type to an enemy and your identity.

Name: Belle Reve

Printings.Flavor: "Dangerous and expendable. My favorite adjectives." —Amanda Waller

Rules:
You get +2 hit points.
Alter-Ego Action: Exhaust Belle Reve and remove 2 status cards from Dr. Harleen Quinzel → give Dr. Harleen Quinzel a tough status card.

Name: Beatrice
Rules:
Restricted. Your basic attack gains overkill.
Hero Interrupt: When you make an attack, exhaust Beatrice and choose an enemy → increase the amount of damage that attack deals to that enemy by 3. Then, stun Harley Quinn.

Name: Criminal Mind

Printings.Flavor: "I don't go crazy. I am crazy. I just go normal from time to time." —Harley Quinn

Rules:
Harley Quinn ignores the patrol keyword and the crisis icon.
Interrupt: When you make a thwart, exhaust Criminal Mind → increase the amount of threat that thwart removes by 2. Then, confuse Harley Quinn.

Name: Limber Lunatic

Printings.Flavor: "My rational mind is in a pretty small box. All tied up with a bow on it." —Harley Quinn

Rules: Interrupt: When an attack is initiated against you, exhaust Limber Lunatic → deal X damage to the attacking character or prevent X damage from that attack, where X is the number of status cards on your identity.

Name: Ellen Ripley

Printings.Flavor: "Get away from her, you b****." —Ellen Ripley

Rules:
{s} Ellen Ripley's basic attack gains ranged.
Interrupt: When your hero would take damage from retaliate, exhaust Ellen Ripley → prevent all of that damage.

Name: Eden Fesi
Rules:
Traveler — Response: After you change to this form, flip a non-Battlefield Untraveled support to its Traveled side.
Forced Response: At the end of the round, flip each Traveled support to its Untraveled side.

Name: Clandestine Intel
Rules: Hero Action (thwart): Confuse the villain and remove threat from a scheme equal to 1 more than the number of Traveled supports you control.

Name: Folding Space

Printings.Flavor: "If he tells the universe to fold itself until he can walk across it in a single step — it does. If he tells space to warp so light passes around him — to form a little bubble of invisibility just for him — it will. He says it's not 'telling.' It's 'asking.' It still terrifies me if I think about it for too long." —Abigail Brand

Rules: Action: Change your form. Draw 1 card.

Name: Quick Portal

Printings.Flavor: "Eden Fesi is not a teleporter. That's not what he does at all. Eden Fesi talks to space." —Abigail Brand

Rules: Hero Interrupt (defense): When you would take any amount of damage from an attack, prevent all of that damage. Then, flip to your alter-ego form.

Name: Sunfire Portal

Printings.Flavor: "I talk to the universe. And we get along, so she does me little favors. Like catch a piece of sun, and move it from there to here." —Manifold

Rules: Hero Action (attack): Deal damage to an enemy equal to 6 more than the number of Traveled supports you control. This attack gains ranged and overkill.

Name: Positional Awareness
Rules: Response: After you spend this card, shuffle a card from your discard pile into your deck. You may flip a Traveled support to its Untraveled side.

Name: Bending Light
Rules:
Max 1 per player.
Manifold gets +2 THW and cannot attack.
Forced Interrupt: When an enemy would initiate an attack against you, it schemes instead.
Forced Interrupt: When the round ends, discard Bending Light.

Name: Manifold's Staff

Printings.Flavor: "What? Where am I going? Ah, you know. Where I always go. Everywhere." —Manifold

Rules:
Manifold gets +1 ATK.
Hero Action: Exhaust Manifold's Staff → ready Manifold.

Name: Gateway

You get +2 hit points.
Alter-Ego Action: Exhaust Gateway → flip to your hero form.

Name: Moondragon

Printings.Flavor: "You see exactly what I wish."

Name: Phyla-Vell

Printings.Flavor: "She's the woman I married. The super hero from the super hero dimension, doing what super heroes do. She's saving the day." —Moondragon

Rules: Response: After Phyla-Vell attacks and defeats an enemy, deal 1 damage to each enemy.

Name: Dragon's Fury
Rules: Hero Action (attack): Deal 7 damage to an enemy. If you paid for this card using a {m} resource, this attack gains ranged and piercing. If you paid for this card using 2 or more {m} resources, this attack also gains overkill. If you paid for this card using 3 or more {m} resources, this attack deals an additional 3 damage.

Name: Focus Beam
Rules: Hero Action (attack): Deal 2 damage to an enemy. If you paid for this card using a {m} resource, deal 2 damage to an enemy. If you paid for this card using 2 or more {m} resources, deal 2 damage to an enemy.

Name: Mental Dominance
Rules:
Hero Action: Choose one of the following:
• Heal 1 damage from Moondragon and draw 1 card.
• Choose a minion. Remove threat from a scheme equal to that minion's SCH or it attacks another enemy of your choice.

Name: Psionic Shield
Rules: Hero Interrupt (defense): When you would take any amount of damage from an attack, prevent all of that damage. If you paid for this card using a {m} resource, heal 1 damage from Moondragon. If you paid for this card using 2 or more {m} resources, deal 2 damage to the attacking enemy.

Name: Memory of Oblivion
Rules: Alter-Ego Action: Spend a {m} resource and exhaust Memory of Oblivion → shuffle 3 different Moondragon cards from your discard pile into your deck.

Name: Meeting of the Minds
Rules:
Hero Resource: Exhaust Meeting of the Minds → generate a {m} resource.
Hero Response: After you play a Superpower card, ready Meeting of the Minds.

Name: Psychic Levitation
Rules:
Moondragon gets +1 DEF and gains the Aerial trait.
Hero Response: After Moondragon defends and takes no damage, exhaust Psychic Levitation → shuffle 1 card from your discard pile into your deck.

Team-Up (Moondragon and Phyla-Vell). Max 1 per deck.
Hero Action: Search your deck and discard pile for a hero-specific card and add it to your hand. (Shuffle.)

{s} Interrupt ({d}): When Arsenal makes a basic attack, treat this attack as though Green Arrow were making a basic attack. If you resolve Green Arrow's "Trick Arrows" ability for this attack, it does not count against its limit.

Hero Action (thwart): Remove 2 threat from a scheme. Remove 1 additional threat from that scheme for each "Special" ability you have resolved this round.

Permanent. Setup.

Reckless. (When this character enters play, place 1 threat on each scheme.)

Requirement ({w}).
Hero Action: Search your deck, hand, and discard pile for a copy of the Spontaneity upgrade and put it into play. If it is already in play, deal 1 damage to a character. Then, place a status card on that character.

Unit Cost 1.
Hero Action (thwart): Name a card type, then look at the top card of your deck. If that card is of the named type, remove 3 threat from the main scheme. Place that card on the top or bottom of your deck, then draw 1 card.

Unit Cost 1.
Hero Action (attack): Place 2 threat on the main scheme. Deal 3 damage to the villain. Draw 1 card.

Unit Cost 2.

Unit Cost 3.

Unit Cost 3.

Permanent. Setup.

Permanent. Setup.
You get +2 hit points.

Permanent. Setup.
You get +1 hit point.

Permanent. Setup.
You get +3 hit points.
Your hero gets +1 DEF.

Name: Vision

Printings.Flavor: "I will handle this."

Rules: Response: After you play White Tiger from your hand, spend a {m} resource → remove 3 threat from a scheme.

Name: Elektra

Printings.Flavor: "I got caught when I tried to help some civilians escape a Hydra patrol. Turns out the civilians were Hydra agents running a sting operation.

Rules: Hero Response: After you spend this card, heal 2 damage from your hero if you are in Giant hero form or draw 1 card if you are in Tiny hero form.

Unit Cost 1.

Rules:
Unit Cost 2.

Name: Take the Fight to Them
Rules:
Unit Cost 3.
Hero Action: Look at the top 2{i} cards of the encounter deck. Discard any number of those, then place the rest on the top and/or bottom of the encounter deck in any order. Draw 1 card.

Rules:
Unit Cost 4.
Hero Interrupt: When an identity would take any amount of damage, exhaust Armor Plating → prevent 1 of that damage (2 of that damage instead if you control the Milano).

Rules:
Unit Cost 4.

Rules:
Unit Cost 4.
Hero Action: Exhaust Hyper Thrusters → remove 1 threat from each scheme. If you control the Milano, remove 1 additional threat from the main scheme.

Rules:
Unit Cost 4.
Hero Action: Exhaust Reactor Core and discard the top 2 cards of your deck (the top card instead if you control the Milano) → reduce the resource cost of the next event you play this turn by 1.

Name: Ardent Resolve
Rules:
Unit Cost 5.
Hero Action: Ready a friendly character. Draw 1 card.

Name: Onrush
Rules:
Unit Cost 5.
Hero Interrupt: When a card is revealed from the encounter deck, cancel the effects of that card and discard it.

Rules:
Unit Cost 6.

Unit Cost 6.

Name: Marvel Boy

Retaliate 1.
Toughness.

Permanent. Setup.

Fragile.

{e} - Draw a card.

Rules: Hero Action (thwart): Remove 2 threat from a scheme. If this is the first card you have played this round, you may take 1 damage to return this card to your hand.

Name: Stun Gun

Printings.Flavor: "This one has twice the stopping power." —Fitz

Rules:
Restricted. Uses (3 charge counters).
Hero Action: Exhaust Stun Gun and remove 1 charge counter from it → deal 1 damage to a minion and stun them.

Name: Last Resort

Printings.Flavor: "I AM VENOM." —Groot

Rules: Hero Interrupt: When a Guardian character you control would take any amount of damage, place 2 threat on the main scheme and discard Last Resort → prevent 6 of that damage.

Name: Weapon X Training

Printings.Flavor: "What they do isn't very nice." —Wolverine

Rules:
Max 1 per player.
Allies you control with 1 hit point remaining get +2 ATK and take 2 additional consequential damage.

Name: "That All You Got?"

Printings.Flavor: "It was a rhetorical question!" —Deadpool

Rules:
Max 1 per round.
Hero Action: Search the encounter deck for an attachment. Reveal that attachment → draw 3 cards. (Shuffle the encounter deck.)

Name: Spider-Man

Printings.Flavor: "Brooklyn doesn't like being run. We're wild like that."

Rules: Response: After you play Spider-Man from your hand, stun and confuse an enemy if you control at least 3 Web-Warrior cards.

Name: Ganke Lee

Printings.Flavor: "I'm the man in the chair."

Rules: Action: Exhaust Ganke Lee → draw 1 card. If you are in hero form, choose and discard 1 card from your hand.

Name: Captain Americat

Printings.Flavor: "I fight in purr-suit of justice and freedom!"

Rules: Response: After Captain Americat enters play, give someone a high five. Place 1 toon counter on your identity and shuffle 1 Spider-Ham card from your discard pile into your deck.

Name: Huge Wooden Hammer
Rules:
Spider-Ham gets +1 ATK.
Hero Interrupt: When Spider-Ham makes a basic attack, exhaust Huge Wooden Hammer and remove 1 toon counter from Spider-Ham → Spider-Ham gets +2 ATK for that attack. That attack gains overkill.

Name: All Systems Go!
Rules:
Hero Action: Choose:
• Ready each Interface upgrade you control.
• Search your deck and discard pile for an Interface upgrade and add it to your hand. (Shuffle.)

Name: SP//dr Command

Printings.Flavor: "Peni, listen to our orders very carefully."

Rules:
Hero Action: Exhaust SP//dr Command and an Interface upgrade → draw 1 card.
Hero Action: Exhaust SP//dr Command and discard 1 card from your hand → ready an Interface upgrade.

Name: Speed-Metal Alloy

Printings.Flavor: "I thought you said it was a suit — this is speed-metal!" —Spider-Ham

Rules: Hero Interrupt: When SP//dr Suit defends against an attack, exhaust Speed-Metal Alloy → it gets +2 DEF for that defense.

Name: Web-Fluid Compressor

Printings.Flavor: "Progress takes patience. That's why we have to keep working on it." —Aunt May

Rules: Hero Interrupt: When SP//dr Suit makes a basic attack, exhaust Web-Fluid Compressor → it gets +2 ATK for that attack.

Name: Multiverse Shenanigans
Rules:
Setup. Max 1 per deck.
Forced Interrupt: When the game begins, choose any 3 different non-determination aspect cards from your collection and set them aside.
Action: Exhaust this card and deal yourself a facedown encounter card → search the set-aside area for 1 of these chosen cards and add it to your hand.

Name: Gorilla-Man

Printings.Flavor: "Dare I say, we're...guerillas?" —Deadpool

Rules: Gorilla-Man ignores "Max 1 per ally" text on upgrades.

Name: Hit-Monkey
Rules: Interrupt: When Hit-Monkey would take any amount of consequential damage, look at the top card of the encounter deck → prevent 1 of that damage for each boost ({b}) and star ({s}) icon looked at this way.

Name: Cumbersome Enhancements
Rules:
Play only if your hero has a printed hand size of 4 or fewer. Max 1 per deck.
Your hero gets +2 hand size.
Forced Interrupt: When the villain phase begins, choose to discard this card or place 1 acceleration token here.

Name: Borrowed Gear
Rules:
Attach to an ally. Max 1 per deck.
Attached ally gets +1 hit point for each upgrade attached to them (to a maximum of +4 hit points).
Forced Response: After Borrowed Gear enters play, attach an ally from your discard pile facedown here → attached ally gains that facedown ally's Traits.

Name: Masacre
Rules:
Hero Response: After Masacre enters play, search your deck and discard pile for a copy of the Merc Squad support and put it into play.
Hero Action: Deal 1 damage to Masacre → place 1 tactic counter on each Merc Squad you control. (Limit once per round.)

Name: Psychic Rapport
Rules:
Team-Up (Cyclops and Phoenix). Max 1 per deck.
Hero Action: Ready Cyclops and Phoenix. Choose to either return a Cyclops card from your discard pile to your hand or place 2 power counters on Phoenix Force.

Name: White Hot Room
Rules:
Alter-Ego Action: Exhaust White Hot Room → choose:
• Place 1 power counter on Phoenix Force.
• Heal 2 damage from Jean Grey.

Name: Phoenix Suit
Rules:
Phoenix gains the Aerial trait.
While you have the Restrained trait, you gain steady.
While you have the Unleashed trait, you gain retaliate 1.

Name: Phoenix Firebird
Rules:
Hero Action: Choose:
• Remove 1 power counter from Phoenix Force → ready Phoenix.
• Place 2 power counters on Phoenix Force.

Name: Compact Darts
Rules:
Permanent.
Hero Response: After your hero attacks, remove 1 dart counter from here → deal 1 damage to up to 2 different enemies.
Alter-Ego Action: Spend 1 resource of any type → place 3 dart counters here. (Limit once per round.)

Name: Laser Goggles
Rules:
Permanent.
Your hero gets -1 THW.
Your hero gets +2 ATK, and your hero's basic attacks gain overkill and piercing.

Name: Propulsion Gauntlet
Rules:
Permanent.
Hero Action: Exhaust Propulsion Gauntlet and take 2 indirect damage → ready your hero. Your hero gets +1 THW, +1 ATK, and +1 DEF until the end of the phase.

Name: Retinal Display
Rules:
Permanent.
Your hero's basic thwart power (THW) can only remove threat from the scheme with the most threat.
Your hero gets +2 THW, and your hero's basic thwarts ignore the crisis icon ({c}) and the patrol keyword.

Name: Shock Knuckles
Rules:
Permanent.
Your hero gets +1 ATK.
Hero Response: After your hero makes a basic attack against an enemy, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If 1 or fewer boost icons ({b}) were discarded this way, stun that enemy.

Name: Wave Bracers
Rules:
Permanent.
Your hero gets -1 ATK.
Your hero gets +2 DEF, and gains retaliate 1 and stalwart.

Name: Compact Darts
Rules:
Setup. Permanent.
Hero Response: After your hero attacks, remove 1 dart counter from here → deal 1 damage to an enemy.
Alter-Ego Action: Spend 1 resource of any type → place 3 dart counters here. (Limit once per round.)

Name: Impact-Dampening Suit
Rules:
Setup. Permanent.
Your identity gets +2 hit points.
Hero Interrupt: When the villain phase begins, spend 1 resource of any type → until the end of the phase, reduce the amount of damage you would take by 1 from each enemy attack.

Name: Laser Goggles
Rules:
Setup. Permanent.
Your hero gets -1 THW.
Your hero gets +1 ATK, and your hero's basic attacks gain overkill.

Name: Propulsion Gauntlet
Rules:
Setup. Permanent.
Hero Action: Exhaust Propulsion Gauntlet and take 2 indirect damage → ready your hero.

Name: Retinal Display
Rules:
Setup. Permanent.
Your hero's basic thwart power (THW) can only remove threat from the scheme with the most threat.
Your hero gets +1 THW, and your hero's basic thwarts ignore the crisis icon ({c}).

Name: Shock Knuckles
Rules:
Setup. Permanent.
Hero Response: After your hero makes a basic attack against an enemy, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If no boost icons ({b}) were discarded this way, stun that enemy.

Name: Wave Bracers
Rules:
Setup. Permanent.
Your hero gets -1 ATK.
Your hero gets +1 DEF, and gains retaliate 1 and steady.

Name: Wrist Navigator
Rules:
Setup. Permanent.
Forced Response: After a minion or side scheme enters play, attach Wrist Navigator to it.
Hero Interrupt: When the attached card is defeated, draw 1 card. (Return this card to your play area.)

Name: Legal Practice

Printings.Flavor: "That's the first time I've ever seen someone argue their way out of a fight." —Spider-Man

Rules: Alter-Ego Action (thwart): Choose and discard up to 5 cards from your hand → remove 1 threat from a scheme for each card discarded this way.

Name: The Power of Leadership
Rules:
Max 2 per deck.
Double the number of resources this card generates while paying for a Leadership (blue) card.

Name: Enhanced Awareness
Rules:
Uses (3 mental counters).
Hero Resource: Exhaust Enhanced Awareness and remove 1 mental counter from it → generate a {m} resource.

Rules: Hero Action: Exhaust Hawkeye's Bow and choose a player → deal 3 damage to the villain and each minion engaged with that player.

Printings.Flavor: "Cap isn't the only soldier who loves his country."

Name: Piercing Strike
Rules: Hero Action (attack): Deal 3 damage to an enemy. This attack gains piercing.

Rules:
Uses (3 energy counters).
Hero Resource: Exhaust Enhanced Reflexes and remove 1 energy counter from it → generate a {e} resource.

Rules: Hero Response: After Wasp enters play, deal 2 damage to an enemy if you are in Giant hero form or remove 2 threat from a scheme if you are in Tiny hero form.

Restricted. Enters play with 2 charge counters on it.

Play under any player's control. Max 1 per player.

Requirement ({m}{m}). Uses (3 research counters).

Team-Up (Colossus and Shadowcat). Max 1 per deck.
Hero Interrupt (attack/defense): When an enemy attacks, prevent all damage from that attack and deal 4 damage to the attacking enemy.

Name: Acute Control

Printings.Flavor: "Do you know how much concentration it takes to phase just my foot?" —Shadowcat

Rules: Hero Response: After you ignore the guard or patrol keyword on a minion, exhaust Acute Control → deal 2 damage to that minion.

Printings.Flavor: "You're about to see something else you're probably not ready for." —Shadowcat

Rules: Hero Action (attack): Deal 3 damage to an enemy. Ready your hero.

Name: Coup de Grâce

Printings.Flavor: "Tally-ho!" —Nightcrawler
"Tally-ho!" —Nightcrawler

Name: Swagger

Printings.Flavor: "Go ahead, bub. Make our day!" —Wolverine
"Go ahead, bub. Make our day!" —Wolverine

Name: Brazen Defense

Name: Ferocious Attack
Rules: Hero Action (attack): Spend 3 resources of any type → deal 6 damage to an enemy and ready your hero. Remove this card from the game and the campaign pool.

Name: War Cry

Rules: Hero Resource: Generate {w}{w} resources for an Attack or Defense event. Gain a tough status card. Remove this card from the game and the campaign pool.

Printings.Flavor: "We've all been there, son." —Cyclops
"We've all been there, son." —Cyclops

Name: Shock and Awe
Rules: Hero Action (attack): Spend 3 resources of any type → deal 6 damage to an enemy and ready each ally you control. Remove this card from the game and the campaign pool.

Name: Surprise!

"Guten Tag!" —Nightcrawler

Rules: Hero Action (thwart): Spend 3 resources of any type → remove 5 threat from among schemes in play. You gain a tough status card. Remove this card from the game and the campaign pool.

Name: Fortitude

Name: Ruby Quartz Visor

Printings.Flavor: Cyclops's visor helps him to focus and control his eye beams.

Rules: Hero Resource: Exhaust this card → generate a {e} resource for your "Optic Blast" ability. That attack gains piercing and ranged.

Name: Field Commander
Rules:
You take the first turn during the player phase. (When your turn is done, play proceeds in player order, starting with the first player. You do not take another turn.)
Each Cyclops upgrade attached to a minion loses the temporary keyword.

Name: Effective Leadership
Rules:
Max 2 per deck.
Interrupt: When you spend this card to play an ally, that ally gets +1 THW and +1 ATK until the end of the phase.

Name: Mutant Peacekeepers
Rules:
Play only if your identity has the X-Men trait.
Hero Action (thwart): Exhaust your hero and any number of X-Men allies → remove X threat from among schemes in play, where X is the total THW of those characters.

Printings.Flavor: A loner by nature, Logan retreats to his cabin when he needs some time away.

Name: Regenerative Healing
Rules:
Action: Choose:
• Heal 4 damage from your identity.
• Discard each stunned and confused status card from your identity.

Setup: Search your deck for a copy of Organic Steel and add it to your hand.
Aspiring Artist — Response: After you change to this form, shuffle a Colossus card from your discard pile into your deck.

Name: Lockheed
Rules:
Response: After Lockheed enters play, if you are in:
• Solid mass form, deal 2 damage to an enemy.

Name: Kitty's Room
Rules:
Alter-Ego Action: Exhaust Kitty's Room → if you are in:
• Solid mass form, heal 2 damage from Kitty Pryde.
• Phased mass form, draw 1 card.

Rules: Hero Interrupt (defense/thwart): When you defend against an attack, spend 2 resources of any type → that attack removes threat from the main scheme instead of dealing damage. Remove this card from the game and the campaign pool.

Rules: Hero Action: Until the end of the phase, prevent all consequential damage each ally would take from thwarting. Remove this card from the game and the campaign pool.

Name: Blizzard
Rules:
Permanent.
Each character gets -1 ATK.
Special: Choose a non-Elite minion → until the end of the round, treat that minion's text box as if it were blank (except for Traits).

Name: Leadership Skill
Rules:
Uses (3 leadership counters). Max 1 per player.
Interrupt: When an ally makes a basic thwart or basic attack action, remove 1 leadership counter from here → that ally gets +1 THW and +1 ATK for that action.

Name: The Thieves Guild
Rules: Alter-Ego Response: After you resolve your "Thief Extraordinaire" ability, remove 1 threat from a scheme. If this removes the last threat from that scheme, draw 1 card.

Play under any player's control. Max 1 per player.
While your hero's remaining hit points are less than half your hero's starting hit points, your hero gets -1 hand size and +2 ATK.

Rules:
Psylocke ignores the guard and patrol keywords.

Psylocke gains retaliate 1.

Rules: {s} Response: After Rictor attacks, discard the top card of your deck. Deal 1 damage to each minion engaged with you for each resource on the discarded card.

Name: Flash Thompson

You can control 1 additional upgrade that has the restricted keyword.

Name: Energy Daggers
Rules:
Special: Choose a player. Deal 1 damage to the villain and to each enemy engaged with that player (2 damage instead if this is the final step of this sequence).
(Play the "Wakanda Forever!" event to use this ability.)

Name: Panther Claws
Rules:
Special (attack): Deal 2 damage to an enemy (4 damage instead if this is the final step of this sequence).
(Play the "Wakanda Forever!" event to use this ability.)

Name: Haymaker

Rules:
Setup.

Unit Cost 2.
Hero Action: Draw 1 card and remove a status card from any character. If the status card type removed this way was:

• Stun - Remove 3 threat from a scheme.
• Confuse - Heal 3 damage from an identity.

Restricted.

Team-Up (Gamora and Nebula). Max 1 per deck.

Hope breaks free from Stryfe's grasp, but she struggles to contain his powerful psionic energies.
"I will leave Hope to finish the job of killing you all," Stryfe laughs. "I have work to do bringing about the Apocalypse!"

Name: Vigilantism
Rules: When Revealed: If Batman is in play, Batman removes 2 threat among schemes, divided as you choose. This card gains surge.
Special: {s} Boost: Give the enemy 1 additional boost card for this activation. If Batman is in play, Batman removes up to 2 threat from the main scheme.

Name: Shadow of the Bat

Printings.Flavor: "Fear is the only language some people understand." —Batman

Rules: When Revealed: If Batman is in play, choose one: draw a card or ready a card. This card gains surge.
Special: {s} Boost: If Batman is in play, prevent all threat and damage from this activation.

Name: Ghosts of the Past
Rules:
Give to the Bruce Wayne player.
You may flip to alter-ego form. Choose:
• Exhaust Bruce Wayne → remove Ghosts of the Past from the game.
• Search and remove all of the deterrence cards from the encounter deck. Add these cards to your deterrence deck. Shuffle the encounter deck. Discard this card.

Name: Two-fer Tuesday

Printings.Flavor: Two-Face is hitting two banks in the area for two million dollars each! Harvey has tipped off Batman about the heist.

Rules:
Forced Interrupt: When the villain phase ends, if the top card of the encounter discard pile has an odd number of boost icons, every player discards a card from their hand.
{h}

Name: Heads I Win

Printings.Flavor: "If I've got even half a chance of beating you, I intend to take it!" —Two-Face

Rules: When Revealed: Deal 2 damage to the hero or ally with the most remaining hit points. Then, deal 2 damage to the hero or ally with the second most remaining hit points. (The player who revealed this card decides ties.)

Name: Laufey
Rules:
Toughness.
When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to the Thor ally.
{s} Forced Interrupt: When Laufey initiates an attack, if he has at least 10{i} remaining hit points, either stun your hero or deal 1 damage to an ally you control.

Name: Laufey
Rules:
Toughness.
When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to the Thor ally.
{s} Forced Interrupt: When Laufey initiates an attack, if he has at least 12{i} remaining hit points, either stun your hero or deal 2 damage to an ally you control.

Name: Journey to Jotunheim
Rules:
Contents: Laufey (I) and Laufey (II). (Laufey (II) and Laufey (III) instead for expert mode.) Laufey and Standard encounter sets. One modular encounter set (recommended: Uncharted Territory).
Setup: Create the Expedition deck (see insert) and reveal the top card of it. Put the Thor ally and King of the Frost Giants attachment into play. Put a Frost Giant Archer into play with each player. Shuffle the encounter deck. Advance to 1B.

Name: Journey to Jotunheim
Rules:
{s} Forced Response: After resolving step one of the villain phase, discard each Expedition environment in play. Then reveal the top card of the expedition deck.
Forced Response: After this scheme is completed, deal 2 damage to the Thor ally. Then, remove all threat from this scheme.

Name: King of the Frost Giants
Rules:
Permanent. Attach to Laufey.
Laufey gains stalwart.
Hero Action: Spend {p}{p} resources → until the end of the round, treat this card's printed text box as if it were blank.

Name: Blizzard

Printings.Flavor: "Thor may be key to saving not only our world, but all ten realms..." —Captain America

Rules: Forced Response: After an ally enters play, exhaust that ally.

Name: Icy Passage

Printings.Flavor: "That's not a mission. Something that epic should be called a quest." —Spider-Man

Rules: Each friendly character gets -1 THW.

Name: Steep Incline

Printings.Flavor: "I say we just follow the river of Frost Giant blood." —Spider-Man

Rules: Each friendly character gets -1 ATK.

Name: Unending Cold

Printings.Flavor: "My ears are too cold to hear anything." —Spider-Man

Rules: Forced Interrupt: As an additional cost to perform a basic REC, that player must discard 1 card from their hand.

Name: Thick Fog

Printings.Flavor: "We need to keep moving." —Captain America

Rules: Forced Interrupt: As an additional cost to perform a basic DEF, that player must discard 1 card from their hand.

Name: Deep Freeze

Printings.Flavor: "Is that all you've got, Giants?" —Thor

Rules: Each player gets -1 hand size.

Name: Frosty Winds

Printings.Flavor: "I hear someone screaming." —Wolverine

Rules: Forced Response: After an upgrade enters play, exhaust it.

Name: Frost Giant Archer
Rules:
Frost Giant Archer enters play with 1 ambush counter on it. While there is at least 1 ambush counter on Frost Giant Archer, it cannot take damage.
Forced Response: After Frost Giant Archer attacks, remove 1 ambush counter from it.
{s} Frost Giant Archer's attacks gain piercing and ranged.

Name: Frost Giant Enforcer
Rules:
Guard. Toughness.
Reduce the amount of damage Frost Giant Enforcer takes from attacks by 1.

Name: Isolated Position
Rules:
Attach to your identity.
Allies you control cannot defend.
Forced Response: After Laufey attacks your hero, discard this card.
Special: {s} Boost: If this attack defeats an ally, attach this card to your identity.

Name: Swinging Club
Rules: When Revealed: Either deal 3 damage to your identity or deal 2 damage to the Thor ally.
Special: {s} Boost: Either give this card 2 boost icons ({b}) or deal 1 damage to the Thor ally.

Name: Treacherous Conditions
Rules:
Surge.
When Revealed: Reveal the top card of the expedition deck.
Special: {s} Boost: Reveal the top card of the expedition deck.

Name: Bloodcycle Canyon
Rules: When Revealed: Each Giant minion engaged with you activates. If no minions activated this way, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Giant minion and put it into play engaged with you.

Name: Giants of Jotunheim
Rules: When Revealed: Give each Giant enemy a tough status card.
Special: {s} Boost: Give Laufey an additional boost card and a tough status card.

Name: Berserker Thor
Rules:
Hinder 2{i}.
The Thor ally takes +1 consquential damage after he attacks or thwarts.
Response: After this scheme is defeated, heal 2 damage from the Thor ally.

Name: Laufey's Club
Rules:
Attach to Laufey. Uses (1 smash counter, plus 1{i} additional smash counters).
{s} Forced Interrupt: When Laufey attacks, remove 1 smash counter from this card → that attack gains overkill.
Special: {s} Boost: This attack gains overkill.

Name: Sensory Disruption
Rules:
Give to the Matt Murdock player.
You may flip to alter-ego form. Choose:
• Exhaust Matt Murdock → remove Sensory Disruption from the game.
• You are confused. This card gains surge. Discard this obligation.

Name: Bullseye

Printings.Flavor: "In my hands anything is a deadly weapon."

Rules:
Quickstrike.
{s} Your hero cannot defend against Bullseye's attacks.

Name: I Never Miss

Printings.Flavor: "You're good Daredevil. I'll grant you that! But I'm better and I'll prove it!" —Bullseye

Rules: When Revealed: Bullseye attacks your hero. Bullseye gains villainous for this attack. If no attack was made this way, deal 2 damage to a character you control.

Name: Price on Your Head
Rules:
Surge.
When Revealed: Place 1{i} threat on the Paid Assassin side scheme.
Special: {s} Boost: Place 1 threat on the Paid Assassin side scheme.

Name: Death Blossom's Bloom

Printings.Flavor: The Swordsman is attempting to dominate the planet for the Cotati. It will empower the Cotati in their mission to eradicate all non-plant life.

Name: Plantman
Rules:
Stalwart. Toughness.
{s} Forced Interrupt: Plantman's attacks gain overkill.
Forced Interrupt: When Plantman is defeated, give the villain a tough status card.

Name: Cotati Resiliency
Rules:
Attach to the enemy with the highest printed hit points and without stalwart. If you cannot, this card gains surge.
Attached enemy gains stalwart.
Hero Action: Spend {m}{p} resources → discard this card.

Name: Family Ties
Rules:
Give to the Shang-Chi player.
You may flip to alter-ego form. Choose:
• Deal 2 damage to Shang-Chi → remove Family Ties from the game.
• Deal 2 damage to each ally. Discard this obligation.

Name: Zheng Zu

Printings.Flavor: "Save your pity for yourself... you'll get none from me."

Rules:
Forced Response: After Zheng Zu schemes, place 1 mystic counter here.
{s} Zheng Zu gets +1 ATK for each mystic counter here.
(Shang-Chi's nemesis minion.)

Name: The Life Stealer

Printings.Flavor: Zheng Zu is casting a ritual to restore himself to full power. Don't let it happen!

Rules:
Victory 1.
Forced Response: After resolving step one of the villain phase, place 1 mystic counter here. After a third mystic counter is placed here, deal 3 indirect damage to each friendly character in play and remove The Life Stealer from the game.

Name: The Life Stealer

Printings.Flavor: Galactus is using The Power Cosmic to steal the heroes' life force!

Rules:
All friendly characters get -1 ATK.
When Revealed: Place 1 additional threat here for each friendly character in play.

Name: Cosmic Power

Printings.Flavor: "The only power you possess, is the power I bestowed upon you."

Rules:
Attach to Galactus. If you cannot, attach to the villain.
{s} Attached enemy's attacks gain overkill.
Hero Action: Take 3 damage → remove Cosmic Power from the game.

Name: The World Eater

Printings.Flavor: "You will claim no victory here today, Norrin Radd. True, you may delay me for a time, but you cannot possibly stop me."

Rules:
Galactus cannot take damage and his attacks gain overkill.
When Defeated: Remove The World Eater from the game.

Name: Kleptomaniac
Rules:
Give to the Selina Kyle player.
You may flip to alter-ego form. Choose:
• Exhaust Selina Kyle and discard a card from your hand → remove Kleptomaniac from the game.
• Each other player discards a card from their hand. You are stunned. Discard this obligation.

Name: Unwavering Justice

Printings.Flavor: The World's Greatest Detective has uncovered some unsettling truths about Catwoman's past. It seems he's not looking the other way this time.

Rules:
When Revealed: Stun each Criminal character in play.
{h}

Name: Complicated Relationship
Rules:
When Revealed (Alter-Ego): Exhaust your identity. If your identity has the Criminal trait, this card gains surge.
When Revealed (Hero): Discard a random card from your hand. If your identity has the Criminal trait, you are stunned. This card gains surge.

Name: Criminally Insane
Rules:
Give to the Dr. Harleen Quinzel player.
You may flip to alter-ego form. Choose:
• Exhaust Dr. Harleen Quinzel and remove all status cards from her → remove Criminally Insane from the game.
• Place 2 threat on the main scheme for each status card on your identity. If no threat was placed this way, this card gains surge. Discard this obligation.

Name: Knock, Knock!

Printings.Flavor: Who's there?!? Punchline of course, now with twice the Joker Toxin!

Name: Punchline

Printings.Flavor: "Then I am the Punchline... I am where you end."

Rules:
Stalwart.
When Revealed: Confuse the identity with the fewest remaining hit points. Confuse the ally with the fewest remaining hit points.

Name: Slapstick
Rules: When Revealed: Deal X damage to the hero or ally with the most remaining hit points, where X is 3 more than the number of status cards on that character. Deal X damage to the hero or ally with the fewest remaining hit points, where X is 1 more than the number of status cards on that character.

Name: Die Laughing
Rules: When Revealed: You are stunned and confused. If you were already stunned, deal 2 damage to your identity. If you were already confused, place 2 threat on the main scheme.

Name: Xenomorph

Printings.Flavor: "In space, no one can hear you scream."

Rules:
Retaliate 1.
When Revealed: Xenomorph gains hidden.
{s} Forced Interrupt: When Xenomorph attacks, it loses hidden.

Name: Xenomorph
Rules:
Retaliate 1.
When Revealed: Xenomorph gains hidden.
{s} Forced Interrupt: When Xenomorph attacks, it loses hidden. When Xenomorph schemes, it gains hidden.

Name: Systems: Nominal
Rules: {s} Forced Response: After resolving step one of the villain phase, if Xenomorph is hidden, place 1{i} additional threat on the main scheme.

Printings.Flavor: The Xenomorph sabotages critical ship systems, drawing the heroes out from their defensive positions.

Name: Systems: Malfunction
Rules:
When Revealed: Each player takes 3 indirect damage.
{s} Forced Response: After resolving step one of the villain phase, if Xenomorph is hidden, place 1{i} additional threat on the main scheme.

Printings.Flavor: The Xenomorph continues sabotaging critical ship systems, destroying the ship's life support systems. It's only a matter of time before the ship becomes completely uninhabitable.

Name: Systems: Critical
Rules:
Forced Interrupt: When the player phase begins, deal 1 damage to each friendly character in play.
{s} Forced Response: After resolving step one of the villain phase, if Xenomorph is hidden, place 1{i} additional threat on the main scheme.
If this stage is completed, the players lose the game.

Name: M314 Motion Tracker
Rules:
Permanent.
Hero Action: Exhaust your hero or spend 2 resources of any type → discard cards from the encounter deck until a Setting card is discarded. Put that card into play and discard each other Setting card in play. Xenomorph loses hidden.
Forced Interrupt: When the player phase begins, attach this card to the first player.

Name: Acidic Blood

Printings.Flavor: "This thing bled acid. Who knows what it's gonna do when it's dead." —Ellen Ripley

Rules:
Attach to Xenomorph. Uses (3 acid counters).
Xenomorph gains retaliate 1.
Forced Response: After Xenomorph is attacked, remove 1 acid counter from this card.

Name: Barbed Tail
Rules:
Attach to Xenomorph.
Uses (3 tail counters).
Forced Response: After Xenomorph attacks and damages a character you control, deal 1 damage to a different character you control. If damage was dealt in this way, remove 1 tail counter from this card.

Name: Facehugger
Rules:
Attach to the ally you control with the most remaining hit points and exhaust it. If you cannot, this card gains surge.
Forced Response: After the player phase ends, remove this card and the attached ally from the game.
Interrupt: When an enemy would take any amount of damage, it may be placed here instead. Then, if there is 3 or more damage here, discard this card.

Name: Hiding in the Shadows

Printings.Flavor: "You still don't understand what you're dealing with, do you? Perfect organism. Its structural perfection is matched only by its hostility." —Science Officer Ash

Rules: When Revealed: Xenomorph gains hidden. You are confused.

Name: Vicious Strikes

Printings.Flavor: "That's it, man! Game over, man. Game over!" —William Hudson

Rules:
When Revealed (Alter-Ego): This card gains surge.
When Revealed (Hero): Give Xenomorph 1 facedown boost card. Xenomorph attacks you.

Name: Infection

Printings.Flavor: Facehuggers are implanting embryos in the crew.

Rules:
Forced Response: After the villain phase ends, discard the top card of your deck. If that card does not have a printed {m} resource, summon a facehugger and reveal it.
{c}

Name: Power Cut

Printings.Flavor: The Xenomorph has damaged the lighting systems, giving it a tactical advantage.

Name: Striking From the Shadows

Printings.Flavor: The Xenomorph waits in the darkness, waiting for his opportunity to strike.

Name: Xeno Drone

Printings.Flavor: "Just tell me one thing. You're going out there to destroy them, right? Not to study. Not to bring back. But to wipe them out." —Ellen Ripley

Rules: Retaliate 1.

Name: Xeno Swarm

Printings.Flavor: The Xenos attack with incredible ferocity.

Name: Terrifying Presence

Printings.Flavor: The ear-piercing shrieks of the Xenos echo through the corridors.

Rules:
Each hero and ally in play gets -1 THW.
{c}

Name: Systems: Nominal
Rules:
Contents: Xenomorph (I) and Xenomorph (II). (Xenomorph (II) and Xenomorph (III) instead for expert mode.) Xenomorph and Standard encounter sets. One modular encounter set (Aliens).
Setup: Attach M314 Motion Tracker to the first player. Discard cards from the encounter deck until an environment is discarded. Put that card into play and shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Advance to Stage 1B.

Name: Cockpit
Rules:
Surge.
When Revealed: Discard each other Setting environment in play.
Xenomorph gets +1 SCH.
Special: {s} Boost: Put this card into play and discard each other Setting environment in play.

Name: Crew Quarters
Rules:
Surge.
When Revealed: Discard each other Setting environment in play.
Identities get -1 REC.
Special: {s} Boost: Put this card into play and discard each other Setting environment in play.

Name: Laboratory
Rules:
Surge.
When Revealed: Discard each other Setting environment in play.
Xenomorph gets +1 ATK.
Special: {s} Boost: Put this card into play and discard each other Setting environment in play.

Name: Workshop
Rules:
Surge.
When Revealed: Discard each other Setting environment in play.
Forced Interrupt: At the end of the villain phase, Xenomorph gains hidden.
Special: {s} Boost: Put this card into play and discard each other Setting environment in play.

Name: Teleportation Exhaustion

Printings.Flavor: "...We just broke some laws. Cosmic ones." —Wiz-Kid

Rules:
Give to the Eden Fesi player.
You cannot flip any Manifold supports to their Traveled side.
Alter-Ego Action: Spend 3 resources of any type → remove Teleportation Exhaustion from the game.

Name: Emperor N'Jadaka

Printings.Flavor: "This is my word. This is my redemption."

Rules:
Retaliate 1.
Forced Interrupt: When the round ends, heal 1 damage from Emperor N'Jadaka.
(Manifold's nemesis minion.)

Name: Symbiotic Fury
Rules:
Attach to Emperor N'Jadaka. If you cannot, attach to the villain.
Attached enemy gains retaliate 1.
{s} Forced Response: After attached enemy attacks you, heal 1 damage from them.
Hero Action: Spend {m}{p} resources → discard this card.

Name: Soulbound Symbiote

Printings.Flavor: "When I pledged myself to the Klyntar, I pledged to something that needed me... something that was me, and thus could never betray me." —Emperor N'Jadaka

Rules: When Revealed: If Emperor N'Jadaka is not in play, summon him and reveal him. Otherwise, Emperor N'Jadaka activates against you.

Name: You're Not Her
Rules:
Give to the Heather Douglas player.
You may flip to alter-ego form. Choose:
• Exhaust Heather Douglas → remove You're Not Her from the game.
• Discard each card in your hand with a printed {m} resource (to a maximum of 3 cards). If no cards were discarded this way, this card gains surge. Discard this obligation.

Name: Dark Side of the Moon

Printings.Flavor: Moondragon faces a battle in her mind against the demonic Dragon of the Moon. If she loses, it could spell the end for the heroes.

Rules:
Forced Interrupt: When the round ends, deal 1 damage to each player.
{a}

Name: Figment Unfragmented
Rules: When Revealed: If Dragon of the Moon is in play, heal all damage from it. Otherwise, summon Dragon of the Moon and reveal it.
Special: {s} Boost: After this activation ends, shuffle this card into the encounter deck.

Name: Treacherous Will

Printings.Flavor: "Oh dear, dear, dear. Someone flinched." —Dragon of the Moon

Rules: When Revealed: Discard an ally you control. If no allies were discarded this way, this card gains surge.
Special: {s} Boost: Deal 1 damage to each character you control.

Name: Dragon of the Moon

Printings.Flavor: "The Dragon gained a foothold in me. At first its influence was subtle... then more intense. In a moment of weakness, I let it take control." —Moondragon

Rules:
Incite 1. Retaliate.
Moondragon cannot resolve her "Dragon of the Moon" ability.
(Moondragon's nemesis minion.)

Name: You Have Failed This City
Rules:
Give to the Oliver Queen player.
You cannot resolve Green Arrow's "Trick Arrows" ability.
Response: After you defeat a minion or side scheme, place 1 redemption counter here. When there are 2 or more redemption counters here, remove You Have Failed This City from the game.
Hero Action: Discard cards from the encounter deck until a minion is discarded. Put that minion into play engaged with the first player. (Limit once per round.)

Name: The Dark Archer

Printings.Flavor: Malcolm Merlyn, the Dark Archer, has returned to prove he is the greatest archer in the world.

Rules:
Forced Response: After a "Special" ability is resolved, deal 1 damage to the resolving player's identity.
{h}

Name: Target Practice
Rules:
When Revealed: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. For each card discarded this way, if that card is:
• Hero-specific - Discard a random card from your hand.
• Aggression or Protection - Take 2 indirect damage.
• Justice or Leadership - Place 1 threat on the main scheme.

Name: Malcolm Merlyn
Rules:
Quickstrike. Villainous.
Malcolm Merlyn's attacks gain ranged and piercing. Allies cannot defend against Malcolm Merlyn's attacks.
(Green Arrow's nemesis minion.)

Name: Secret Intent

Printings.Flavor: "Why would Gwen steal from us?" —Miles

Rules:
Treat attached ally as a Skrull minion with a blank text box. Attached minion's SCH is equal to its printed THW and it does not take consequential damage.
When Revealed: Attach to the ally with the highest ATK. Attached ally engages its controller. Otherwise, this card gains surge.

Name: Skrull Infiltration

Printings.Flavor: They could be anyone?

Name: Scenario 1 - Setup
Rules:
Campaign Setup: Each player must construct a deck (using normal deck-building rules) that contains anywhere from 5 to 10 allies. Then, create a side deck of 10 cards using basic cards and cards from your chosen aspect that are not already included in your player deck. You may want to include a few allies in this side deck as well.
Scenario 1 - Red Skull Runs Rampant: Red Skull (I) and Red Skull (II) (Red Skull (II) and Red Skull (III) for expert). Red Skull, Galactic Artifacts, Hydra Patrol, Power Stone, and Standard encounter sets. When the game is setup, proceed to Con of Heroes Campaign 1B.

Name: Red Skull Runs Rampant

Printings.Flavor: "Listen up, heroes! The Red Skull is at it again. This is Nick Fury: S.H.I.E.L.D. needs your assistance. It seems as though he's gathered artifacts and tech from all over the universe. Get in her and shut this down before it gets out of control! Over and out."

Rules: As a team, engage the Red Skull in battle! After the scenario is won or lost, proceed to Con of Heroes Campaign 2A and begin your next mission.

Name: Scenario 2 - Setup
Rules:
Rewards: Each player chooses a Hydra Campaign Tech upgrade from The Rise of Red Skull expansion and adds it to their deck. If the players won the last scenario, the first player begins this scenario with the Power Stone under their control. Otherwise, give it to the villain.
Scenario 2 - Badoon Strike Force: Drang (I) and Drang (II). Brotherhood of Badoon, A New Standard, Black Order, Children of Thanos, Ship Command, Power Stone, and Standard encounter sets. Set the Reality Stone environment (from the Infinity Gauntlet set in the Mad Titan's Shadow expansion) into play next to Drang.

Name: Badoon Strike Force

Printings.Flavor: Moments after Red Skull is defeated, a Badoon trooper grabs a satchel from the villain's side and immediately teleports back to the Badoon Assault Cruiser overhead. "Alright, things seem to have gone from bad to worse... first Hydra, now aliens?"

Rules:
Special Rule: Each time the Charge Up ability removes barrage counters from the Badoon Ship environment, resolve the first sentence of the "Special" ability on the Reality Stone environment.
As a team, engage Drang in battle! After the scenario is won or lost, proceed to Con of Heroes Campaign 3A and begin your next mission.

Name: Unlikely Alliance

Printings.Flavor: You engage in battle with the Mad Titan himself who has ditched his typical Black Order flunkies for an unlikely alliance between the sneaky shapeshifting Skrull forces and the unpredictable and aggressive Klyntar symbiotes!

Rules:
Special Rule: After you defeat a minion, shuffle an ally from your pile of allies you removed during setup back into your deck.
As a team, engage Thanos in battle! After the scenario is won or lost, proceed to Con of Heroes Campaign 4A and begin your final mission.

Name: Scenario 3 - Setup

Printings.Flavor: As Drang falls, Thanos emerges from a portal, and snaps his ungloved fingers, grinning. You look around as your former allies morph into Skrull secret agents!

Rules:
Rewards: Remove each ally from your deck and reconstruct your deck using cards from your side deck. Then, add one Captive ally and 1 copy of the Shawarma resource (from The Rise of Red Skull and Mad Titan's Shadow expansions) to your deck.
Scenario 3 - Unlikely Alliance: Thanos (I) and Thanos (II) (Thanos (II) and Thanos (III) for expert). Thanos, A New Standard, Infinity Gauntlet, Skrull Infiltration, Symbiotic Strength, and Standard encounter sets. When the game is setup, proceed to Con of Heroes Campaign 3B.

Name: Scenario 4 - Setup

Printings.Flavor: Upon landing the final blow, Thanos' face shifts into that of an unconscious Skrull! The roar of a landing Quinjet suddenly grabs everyone's attention. Time to investigate!

Rules:
Rewards: Build a new 40-card deck using the available cards from your deck and side deck. Then, add any previous campaign rewards, and a Basic Hydra Campaign upgrade from The Rise of Red Skull.
Scenario 4 - Meanwhile, Back in New York...: Venom Goblin (I) and Venom Goblin (II) (Venom Goblin (II) and Venom Goblin (III) for expert). Venom Goblin, A New Standard, Skrull Infiltration, Symbiotic Strength, and Standard encounter sets. When set up, proceed to Con of Heroes Campaign 4B.

Name: Meanwhile, Back in New York...

Printings.Flavor: The Quinjet is filled with the allies who had been replaced with Skrull sleeper agents! "They had us all pinned down--turns out this was all a distraction to get us off Earth so they could invade New York! We're enroute now, but some of you look pretty beat--you might want to see Fury about getting some basic improvements for this battle."

Rules:
Special Rule: If your team lost the previous scenario, each player on your team may flip their Basic Hydra Campaign upgrade to its Improved side.
As a team, engage the Venom Goblin in battle! After the scenario is won or lost, report your results and celebrate your true (or moral) victory!

Name: Distracting Fly By

Printings.Flavor: I'm somewhat of a DISTRACTION myself!

Rules:
Hinder 1{i}.
When Revealed: Discard your hand and draw 4 cards.
Forced Response: After step 1 of the villain phase, place threat on the main scheme equal to the amount of threat here.

Name: Sweeping Strike
Rules:
When Revealed: Discard a random card from hand. The villain attacks your hero. That attack deals indirect damage. If the discarded card's printed resource has:
{e} - The villain heals 1 damage for each character damaged by that attack.
{m} - Place 1 threat on the main scheme for each character damaged by that attack.
{p} - The villain gets +2 ATK for that attack.
{w} - All of the above. Draw 1 card.

Name: Chain Reaction
Rules: When Revealed: Discard an ally, upgrade, or support you control. Then, discard each card in your hand with a cost equal to or greater than the discarded card.
Special: {s} Boost: Discard 1 random card from your hand.

Name: Join Forces!
Rules: When Revealed: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until you discard a minion. Reveal that minion. Discard a card from your hand for each minion engaged with you. The villain attacks your hero.
Special: {s} Boost: Discard 1 random card from your hand if you are engaged with a minion.

Name: Bringing in New Talent
Rules:
Surge.
When Revealed: Shuffle your set-aside nemesis set into the encounter deck. If no cards were shuffled in this way, discard a random card from your hand.
Special: {s} Boost: After this activation, shuffle this card into the encounter deck.

Name: Skrull Spy Overseer

Printings.Flavor: "The could be anyone--even our friends..." —Black Widow

Rules:
X is equal to the number of friendly characters in play.
When Revealed: Discard the ally with the lowest printed cost.

Name: Skrull Sleeper Agent
Rules: When Revealed: Remove an ally your control from the game. If no ally is removed this way, this card gains surge.
Special: {s} Boost: After this activation, shuffle this card into the encounter deck.

Name: Paranoia
Rules: When Revealed: The two allies with the highest ATK simultaneously deal damage to each other equal to their ATK. If no allies were defeated this way, this card gains surge.
Special: {s} Boost: Deal 1 damage to each ally you control.

Name: Midtown Manhattan
Rules:
When Revealed: Move the glider counter and each acceleration token from here to the main scheme with the least threat.
If there are at least 2 Symbiote environments in play, the players lose the game.

Name: Attack on Xavier's

Printings.Flavor: The Brotherhood strike in unison, focusing their attack on...

Rules: When Revealed: Flip this card.

Name: Attack on Xavier's

Printings.Flavor: The Brotherhood strike in unison, focusing their attack on...

Rules: When Revealed: Flip this card.

Name: Attack on Xavier's

Printings.Flavor: The Brotherhood strike in unison, focusing their attack on...

Rules: When Revealed: Flip this card.

Name: Attack on Xavier's

Printings.Flavor: The Brotherhood strike in unison, focusing their attack on...

Rules: When Revealed: Flip this card.

Printings.Flavor: Panicked civilians crowd the area. It is difficult to confront Rhino without putting them at risk. Get the people to safety!

Name: Program Transmitter
